pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:0.5.eng: 89. The training rule on sitting mats

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ nisīdanaṃ anuññātaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.2.eng: he allowed sitting mats for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.4.eng: Knowing this, the monks from the group of six used sitting mats that were inappropriate in size.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.5.eng: The sitting mats hung down from beds and benches, both in front and behind.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.6.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.6.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū appamāṇikāni nisīdanāni dhāressantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.7.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six use such sitting mats?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, appamāṇikāni nisīdanāni dhārethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, appamāṇikāni nisīdanāni dhāressatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.11.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.13.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a monk is having a sitting mat made, it is to be made the right size.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.15.pli: Tatridaṃ pamāṇaṃ—dīghaso dve vidatthiyo, sugatavidatthiyā; tiriyaṃ diyaḍḍhaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.15.eng: This is the right size: two standard handspans long and one-and-a-half wide.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.16.eng: If it exceeds that, it is to be cut down, and he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.17.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:1.17.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā udāyī mahākāyo hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.1.eng: At that time there was a big monk called Venerable Udāyī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.2.pli: So bhagavato purato nisīdanaṃ paññapetvā samantato samañchamāno nisīdati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.2.eng: After putting out his sitting mat in front of the Buddha, he stretched it on all sides before sitting down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.4.eng: “Udāyī, why are you stretching the sitting mat on all sides,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.6.pli: “Tathā hi pana, bhante, bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ atikhuddakaṃ nisīdanaṃ anuññātan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.6.eng: “Because, sir, the sitting mat you’ve allowed for the monks is too small.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.7.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.8.eng: “Monks, I allow a border of one handspan for the sitting mat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.9.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.9.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.10.1.eng: ‘If a monk is having a sitting mat made, it should be made the right size.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.11.pli: Tatridaṃ pamāṇaṃ—dīghaso dve vidatthiyo, sugatavidatthiyā; tiriyaṃ diyaḍḍhaṃ. Dasā vidatthi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.11.eng: This is the right size: two standard handspans long and one-and-a-half wide, and a border of one handspan.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.11.comm: For an explanation of rendering sugata as “standard”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:2.12.eng: If it exceeds that, it is to be cut down, and he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.2.eng: one with a border is what is meant.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.4.pli: karonto vā kārāpento vā pamāṇikaṃ kāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.4.eng: making it himself or having it made, it should be made the right size.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.5.pli: Tatridaṃ pamāṇaṃ— dīghaso dve vidatthiyo, sugatavidatthiyā; tiriyaṃ diyaḍḍhaṃ. Dasā vidatthi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.5.eng: This is the right size: two standard handspans long and one-and-a-half wide, and a border of one handspan.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.6.pli: Taṃ atikkāmetvā karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge dukkaṭaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.6.eng: If he makes one, or has one made, that exceeds that, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.7.eng: When he gets it, it is to be cut down, and he is then to confess an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.8.1.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.8.1.eng: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.9.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.9.eng: If he has others finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.10.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.10.eng: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.11.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.11.eng: If he has others finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.12.pli: Aññassatthāya karoti vā kārāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.12.eng: If he makes one or has one made for the benefit of someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.13.pli: Aññena kataṃ paṭilabhitvā paribhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.1.13.eng: If he gets one that was made by someone else and then uses it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.2.2.eng: if he makes it the right size;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.2.3.eng: if he makes it smaller than the right size;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.2.4.pli: aññena kataṃ pamāṇātikkantaṃ paṭilabhitvā chinditvā paribhuñjati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.2.4.eng: if he gets one made by another that exceeds the right size and then cuts it down before using it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.2.5.pli: vitānaṃ vā bhūmattharaṇaṃ vā sāṇipākāraṃ vā bhisiṃ vā bibbohanaṃ vā karoti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.2.5.eng: if he makes a canopy, a floor cover, a cloth screen, a mattress, or a pillow;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.2.7.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc89:3.2.8.eng: The training rule on sitting mats, the seventh, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:0.5.eng: 9. The training rule on telling about what is grave

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā upanando sakyaputto chabbaggiyehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ bhaṇḍanakato hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.2.eng: Venerable Upananda the Sakyan was quarreling with the monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.3.pli: So sañcetanikaṃ sukkavissaṭṭhiṃ āpattiṃ āpajjitvā saṅghaṃ tassā āpattiyā parivāsaṃ yāci.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.3.eng: He then committed an offense of intentional emission of semen. He asked the Sangha for probation for that offense,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.4.pli: Tassa saṅgho tassā āpattiyā parivāsaṃ adāsi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāvatthiyaṃ aññatarassa pūgassa saṅghabhattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.5.eng: Just then an association in Sāvatthī was offering a meal to the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.6.eng: Because Upananda was on probation, he sat on the last seat in the dining hall.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.7.eng: The monks from the group of six then told those lay followers,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.8.pli: “eso, āvuso, āyasmā upanando sakyaputto tumhākaṃ sambhāvito kulūpako; yeneva hatthena saddhādeyyaṃ bhuñjati teneva hatthena upakkamitvā asuciṃ mocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.8.eng: “This Venerable Upananda, the esteemed associate of your families, eats the food given in faith with the same hand he uses to masturbate.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.9.pli: So sañcetanikaṃ sukkavissaṭṭhiṃ āpattiṃ āpajjitvā saṅghaṃ tassā āpattiyā parivāsaṃ yāci.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.9.eng: After committing an offense of intentional emission of semen, he asked the Sangha for probation for that offense,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.10.pli: Tassa saṅgho tassā āpattiyā parivāsaṃ adāsi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.11.eng: And because he’s on probation, he now sits on the last seat.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.12.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.12.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.13.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhussa duṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ anupasampannassa ārocessantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.13.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six tell a person who’s not fully ordained about a monk’s grave offense?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.14.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, bhikkhussa duṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ anupasampannassa ārocethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.14.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.17.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, bhikkhussa duṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ anupasampannassa ārocessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.17.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.19.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.19.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.20.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhussa duṭṭhullaṃ āpattiṃ anupasampannassa āroceyya, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:1.20.1.eng: ‘If a monk tells a person who is not fully ordained about a monk’s grave offense, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.8.pli: cattāri ca pārājikāni, terasa ca saṅghādisesā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.8.eng: the four offenses entailing expulsion and the thirteen entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.9.eng: A person who is not fully ordained:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.10.pli: bhikkhuñca bhikkhuniñca ṭhapetvā avaseso anupasampanno nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.10.eng: anyone except a fully ordained monk or a fully ordained nun.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.12.pli: āroceyya itthiyā vā purisassa vā gahaṭṭhassa vā pabbajitassa vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.12.eng: tells a woman or a man, a lay person or a monastic.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.13.eng: Except if the monks have agreed:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.15.1.eng: There is agreement of the monks with a limit on offenses, but not on families.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.16.pli: Atthi bhikkhusammuti kulapariyantā, na āpattipariyantā, atthi bhikkhusammuti āpattipariyantā ca kulapariyantā ca, atthi bhikkhusammuti neva āpattipariyantā na kulapariyantā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.16.eng: There is agreement of the monks with a limit on families, but not on offenses. There is agreement of the monks with a limit both on offenses and on families. There is agreement of the monks with neither a limit on offenses nor on families.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.18.eng: offenses are specified: “These particular offenses can be told about.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.20.eng: families are specified: “These particular families can be told.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.21.eng: With a limit both on offenses and on families:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.22.pli: āpattiyo ca pariggahitāyo honti, kulāni ca pariggahitāni honti— “ettakāhi āpattīhi ettakesu kulesu ārocetabbo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.22.eng: both offenses and families are specified: “These particular offenses can be told about, and these particular families can be told.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.23.eng: With neither a limit on offenses nor on families:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.24.pli: āpattiyo ca apariggahitāyo honti, kulāni ca apariggahitāni honti— “ettakāhi āpattīhi ettakesu kulesu ārocetabbo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.24.eng: neither offenses nor families are specified in this way.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.25.1.pli: Āpattipariyante yā āpattiyo pariggahitāyo honti, tā āpattiyo ṭhapetvā aññāhi āpattīhi āroceti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.25.1.eng: When there is a limit on offenses, if he tells about other offenses than those that are specified, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.26.pli: Kulapariyante yāni kulāni pariggahitāni honti, tāni kulāni ṭhapetvā aññesu kulesu āroceti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.26.eng: When there is a limit on families, if he tells other families than those that are specified, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.27.pli: Āpattipariyante ca kulapariyante ca yā āpattiyo pariggahitāyo honti, tā āpattiyo ṭhapetvā yāni kulāni pariggahitāni honti, tāni kulāni ṭhapetvā aññāhi āpattīhi aññesu kulesu āroceti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.27.eng: When there is a limit both on offenses and on families, if he tells about other offenses than those that are specified or he tells other families than those that are specified, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.1.28.eng: When there is neither a limit on offenses nor on families, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.2.1.pli: Duṭṭhullāya āpattiyā duṭṭhullāpattisaññī anupasampannassa āroceti, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.2.1.eng: If the offense is grave, and he perceives it as such, and he tells a person who is not fully ordained, then, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.2.2.pli: Duṭṭhullāya āpattiyā vematiko anupasampannassa āroceti, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.2.2.eng: If the offense is grave, but he is unsure of it, and he tells a person who is not fully ordained, then, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.2.3.pli: Duṭṭhullāya āpattiyā aduṭṭhullāpattisaññī anupasampannassa āroceti, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.2.3.eng: If the offense is grave, but he perceives it as minor, and he tells a person who is not fully ordained, then, except if the monks have agreed, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.2.4.eng: If he tells about a minor offense, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.2.5.pli: Anupasampannassa duṭṭhullaṃ vā aduṭṭhullaṃ vā ajjhācāraṃ āroceti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.2.5.eng: If he tells about the misconduct of a person who is not fully ordained, whether grave or minor, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.2.6.eng: If the offense is minor, but he perceives it as grave, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.2.7.eng: If the offense is minor, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.2.8.eng: If the offense is minor, and he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.3.2.eng: if he tells about the action that was the basis for the offense, but not the class of offense;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.3.3.eng: if he tells about the class of offense, but not the action that was the basis for the offense;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.3.6.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc9:2.3.7.eng: The training rule on telling about what is grave, the ninth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:0.5.eng: 90. The training rule on itch covers

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ kaṇḍuppaṭicchādi anuññātā hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.2.eng: he allowed itch-covering cloths for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.4.eng: Knowing this, the monks from the group of six wore itch covers that were inappropriate in size.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.5.eng: As they were walking about, they were dragging them along, both in front and behind.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.6.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.6.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū appamāṇikāyo kaṇḍuppaṭicchādiyo dhāressantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.7.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six wear such itch covers?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, appamāṇikāyo kaṇḍuppaṭicchādiyo dhārethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, appamāṇikāyo kaṇḍuppaṭicchādiyo dhāressatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.11.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.13.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a monk is having an itch-covering cloth made, it should be made the right size.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.15.pli: Tatridaṃ pamāṇaṃ—dīghaso catasso vidatthiyo, sugatavidatthiyā; tiriyaṃ dve vidatthiyo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.15.eng: This is the right size: four standard handspans long and two wide.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.15.comm: For an explanation of rendering sugata as “standard”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:1.16.eng: If it exceeds that, it is to be cut down, and he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.2.pli: yassa adhonābhi ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalaṃ kaṇḍu vā pīḷakā vā assāvo vā thullakacchu vā ābādho, tassa paṭicchādanatthāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.2.eng: it is for the purpose of covering an itch or a boil or a running sore or a carbuncle, below the navel and above the knees.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.4.pli: karonto vā kārāpento vā. Pamāṇikā kāretabbā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.4.eng: making it himself or having it made, it should be made the right size.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.5.pli: Tatridaṃ pamāṇaṃ— dīghaso catasso vidatthiyo, sugatavidatthiyā; tiriyaṃ dve vidatthiyo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.5.eng: This is the right size: four standard handspans long and two wide.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.6.pli: Taṃ atikkāmetvā karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge dukkaṭaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.6.eng: If he makes one or has one made that exceeds that, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.7.eng: When he gets it, it is to be cut down, and he is then to confess an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.8.1.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.8.1.eng: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.9.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.9.eng: If he has others finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.10.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.10.eng: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.11.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.11.eng: If he has others finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.12.pli: Aññassatthāya karoti vā kārāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.12.eng: If he makes one or has one made for the benefit of someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.13.pli: Aññena kataṃ paṭilabhitvā paribhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.13.eng: If he gets one that was made by someone else and then uses it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.15.eng: if he makes it the right size;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.16.eng: if he makes it smaller than the right size;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.17.pli: aññena kataṃ pamāṇātikkantaṃ paṭilabhitvā chinditvā paribhuñjati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.17.eng: if he gets one made by another that exceeds the right size and then cuts it down before using it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.18.pli: vitānaṃ vā bhūmattharaṇaṃ vā sāṇipākāraṃ vā bhisiṃ vā bibbohanaṃ vā karoti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.18.eng: if he makes a canopy, a floor cover, a cloth screen, a mattress, or a pillow;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.20.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc90:2.21.eng: The training rule on itch covers, the eighth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:0.5.eng: 91. The training rule on the rainy-season robe

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ vassikasāṭikā anuññātā hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:1.2.eng: he allowed rainy-season robes for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:1.4.eng: Knowing this, the monks from the group of six wore rainy-season robes that were inappropriate in size.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:1.5.eng: As they were walking about, they were dragging them along, both in front and behind.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:1.6.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:1.6.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū appamāṇikāyo vassikasāṭikāyo dhāressantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:1.7.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six wear such rainy-season robes?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, appamāṇikāyo vassikasāṭikāyo dhārethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, appamāṇikāyo vassikasāṭikāyo dhāressatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:1.11.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:1.13.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a monk is having a rainy-season robe made, it should be made the right size.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:1.15.pli: Tatridaṃ pamāṇaṃ—dīghaso cha vidatthiyo, sugatavidatthiyā; tiriyaṃ aḍḍhateyyā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:1.15.eng: This is the right size: six standard handspans long and two-and-a-half wide.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:1.15.comm: For an explanation of rendering sugata as “standard”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:1.16.eng: If it exceeds that, it is to be cut down, and he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.2.eng: it is for use during the four months of the rainy season.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.4.pli: karonto vā kārāpento vā. Pamāṇikā kāretabbā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.4.eng: making it himself or having it made, it should be made to the right size.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.5.pli: Tatridaṃ pamāṇaṃ— dīghaso cha vidatthiyo, sugatavidatthiyā; tiriyaṃ aḍḍhateyyā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.5.eng: This is the right size: six standard handspans long and two and a half wide.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.6.pli: Taṃ atikkāmetvā karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge dukkaṭaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.6.eng: If he makes one or has one made that exceeds that, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.7.eng: When he gets it, it is to be cut down, and he is then to confess an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.8.1.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.8.1.eng: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.9.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.9.eng: If he has others finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.10.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.10.eng: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.11.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.11.eng: If he has others finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.12.pli: Aññassatthāya karoti vā kārāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.12.eng: If he makes one or has one made for the benefit of someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.13.pli: Aññena kataṃ paṭilabhitvā paribhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.13.eng: If he gets one that was made by someone else and then uses it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.15.eng: if he makes it the right size;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.16.eng: if he makes it smaller than the right size;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.17.pli: aññena kataṃ pamāṇātikkantaṃ paṭilabhitvā chinditvā paribhuñjati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.17.eng: if he gets one made by another that exceeds the right size and then cuts it down before using it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.18.pli: vitānaṃ vā bhūmattharaṇaṃ vā sāṇipākāraṃ vā bhisiṃ vā bibbohanaṃ vā karoti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.18.eng: if he makes a canopy, a floor cover, a cloth screen, a mattress, or a pillow;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.20.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc91:2.21.eng: The training rule on the rainy-season robe, the ninth, is finished.
